person.persName: Lafayette Montgomery Flournoy (Paducah, Kentucky, attorney, banker, and entrepreneur)

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, attorney, banker, and entrepreneur. Born in Powhatan County, Virginia. Married to Elizabeth C. Anderson Flournoy in 1850. Father of Richard C. A. Flournoy. Graduated from Cumberland College at Princeton, Kentucky, in 1840. Studied law with William P. Fowler. Admitted to the bar in 1841. Moved to Paducah, Kentucky, and opened practice. Attorney in Paducah from 1841 to 1849. Practiced with Judge James Campbell. Editor of the West Kentuckian in Paducah from 1844 to 1849. President of the Commercial Bank of Kentucky branch at Paducah from 1853 to 1865. President of the Paducah Gaslight Company. Established the Paducah and Nashville Telegraph Company extending from Paducah to Nashville, Tennessee, with J. W. Jones in 1856. President of the New Orleans and Ohio River Railroad Company in 1865.
